meanings.definition: A person who is a gossip or busybody.
meanings.sent1: The yentes in the neighborhood always know everyone's business.
meanings.sent2: She is known as the biggest yentes in town.
meanings.sent3: The yentes at the party couldn't resist sharing the latest rumors.
meanings.sent4: The yentes' ears were always buzzing with the latest news.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the yentes, for they hear all and tell all.

meanings.definition: To gossip or meddle in other people's business.
meanings.sent1: She loves to yentes about her neighbors.
meanings.sent2: They always yentes about others behind their backs.
meanings.sent3: I caught her trying to yentes about my personal life.
meanings.sent4: He tends to yentes when he's bored.
meanings.sent5: The group gathered to yentes about the latest scandal.
